Description of incident: A Miami man was charged with buying              confidential patient records from a Jackson Memorial Hospital employee              over the past two years, and selling them to a lawyer suspected of              soliciting the patients to file personal-injury claims.UPDATE (10/26/10): Ruben E. Rodriquez was sentenced to 11 years in prison for selling patient records to lawyers for injury claims.  Rodriquez stole 3,350 patient records in 2008 and 2009.  He may have also sold information in 2007.  The information included name, contact information and medical diagnoses.
